ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Korean in various aspects of the language.
I learned how to speak, write, listen, and read Korean at a better level.
I leanred how to express my opinions in a variety of ways, and about different korean media and culture.
I gained a deeper knowledge into Korean culture and greatly enhanced my bank of vocab and expressions.
I developed my speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills in korean.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course was taught as well as it could be.
It was great to be able to speak freely, I feel like my conversational skills really improved, as did my reading comprehension. And of course the best part of the course is  ! She is the best!
The course is well organized with a speaking focused and presentational style which is useful for gaining practical knowledge and skills in Korean.  No real flaws.

This course focused a lot on vocabulary and speaking practice! Sometimes the assignments were a little unclear as to what we were supposed to do, but asking in class would clarify it and grading was extremely fair! You will definitely learn a lot in this class!

Strengths: Lee ssn! She is very encouraging and really wants all of her students to enjoy the class and succeed. I also liked that we covered lots of different types of media in the course (movies, newspapers, ads, etc). Weaknesses: n/a

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would if you have a good reason to study Korean! Not much else to say there.
Yes! Just keep up on your work!
Yes! It is a very friendly and engaging classroom enviornment.

If you are interested in studying Korean at this level, this is a great option.  Professor Lee-Smith is an amazing and kind hearted person, and the class really builds a familial relationship and deep ties to each other.  I highly recommend 151.
Yes, I learned a lot and had so much fun! It was well-organized and well-taught.
Yes! It's a great course that pushes you to communicate at a higher language level.
